main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in Scranton, Pennsylvania, on 15 November 1952, by a trained observer who described it as cylindrical and glowing.
interesting points: The object was observed at an altitude of approximately 15,000 feet for about 3 to 5 minutes., The object traveled at an estimated speed of 400 to 500 miles per hour., It was described as being 40 to 50 feet in length and emitted a bright steady light., The object did not show any trails or exhaust and was not detected on radar., A witness reported seeing 8 to 10 metallic objects flying in a straight line at an altitude of 6,000 to 8,000 feet shortly after the incident.
sighted object: cylindrical object emitting a bright light
witness description: The witness was a trained observer and later described an incident where they felt paralyzed while looking at the object.
